result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Francisco Miranda Rivera

records.addlTxt: Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the information.  Defendant pleas NG. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 2:49 pm.

2:40 PM Francisco Miranda Rivera appears by phone,  Atty Travis Satorius, ADA Kaley Walker for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF112 (PH) and 22CT27 (STC). DE wishes to waive the PH. Court questions DE. Court finds defendant freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the Defendant probably committed a felony. Court binds defendant over for further proceedings.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.
filed by ADA Kaley Walker. eif
from SPD office requesting Defendant appear remotely for today's hearing, Defendant has transportation issues.

1:50 PM Francisco Miranda Rivera appeared in Court,  Atty Travis Satorius appeared in court, ADA Kaley Walker appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF112 and 22CT27 (STC). ADA Walker states a PH is needed and 22CT27 will follow. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 1:53 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
filed by Atty Satorius

DE from PCJ

3:37 PM Defendant Francisco Miranda Rivera appears from Jail via video, Atty Travis Satorius appears by phone, DA Halle E. Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF112 and 22CT27 (RW). Court questions non-appearance, he lives in Red Wing and did try to reach out. Court will quash the warrant and reinstate the bonds. DE does qualify for PD. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:43 pm.  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
DE in custody - E: DA & Email: Jail & Dispatch. eif

9:12 AM Defendant Francisco Miranda Rivera does not appear in Court, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF112 and 22CT27. Due to non-appearance ADA Walker is requesting a warrant adj. States on 22CF112 and a Statewide warrant on 22CT27.
Status conference on July 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant to maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Def from PCJ

3:14 PM Defendant Francisco Miranda Rivera appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Joseph Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Schieffer is requesting a $10,000.00 SIBS w/conditions of AS, no objection. Court so orders.  DE will retain counsel. Court adjourned at 3:21 pm.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
